lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dirty ass voice actors?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that what you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is what I said.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's accurate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Before we go into tonight's game, we have a couple of quick announcements to go through, one of which is kind of awesome. First and foremost, we have our fantastic friends and sponsors of this campaign thus far and going on to infinity, D&D Beyond. Sam, if you want to talk a little bit about that, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to play it for you tonight, and you might enjoy it. Have you guys seen it yet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're about to!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, they did it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was so wonderful! We're an 80s cartoon, guys!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's so good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's weirdly emotional.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's all of our characters, animated! We have to give some shout outs to Kamille and Kevin Areopagita for working on this. Those were the animators. Go visit at Twitter @Karekareo. We'll put it up on the thing. You can visit their Patreon, Patreon.com/kiframe. It's really cool, and it's really fast, so we thought we might play it again.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (chanting) Again! One more time! [drum intro] ♪ You got the perfect warlock, ♪ ♪ her weapons and supplies ♪ ♪ But you need a place to track your stuff ♪ ♪ 'cause you're so disorganized! ♪ ♪ You click open the web page ♪ ♪ you heard about on Critical Role ♪ ♪ *And now you're ready to kick some butt ♪ ♪ *in that mineshaft full of gnolls! ♪ ♪ It's D&D! (D&D) ♪ ♪ D&D Beyond ♪ ♪ Yeah D&D! (D&D) ♪ ♪ D&D Beyond ♪ ♪ You got your stats, you got your sword ♪ ♪ and you've got your invisible wand! ♪ ♪ It's D&D! (D&D) ♪ ♪ D&D! ♪ ♪ D&D Beyond! ♪ (cheering)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, Sam!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not me, it's them! It's the D&D!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those fucking vocals, son. That shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How layered was that harmony at the end?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's all kinds of stuff going on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The synth gives me 80s life in the best way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want to plug their Patreon again because they deserve it. That's patreon.com/kiframe. Go check out their work. They're fantastic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Unreal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will be watching that on repeat until 3:00am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we all cry if we can get the whole game tonight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It wouldn't be Critical Role if we didn't at some point. Thank you, D&D Beyond, for being fantastic partners in this and for making that shit happen! (voice cracking) Okay, moving on. Oh man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (voice cracking) Emotional cry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know! Vox Machina: Origins, the hardcover, the physical copy went on sale today! It is available for purchase now through our friends at Dark Horse. You can find all the details at critrole.com. It includes the collection of the six issue, Vox Machina: Origins comic arc, previously digital release only, as well as a bunch of extras in the back. The art process and the designing of the characters, a whole map of Stilben, and a bunch of information about some of the characters, creatures, and items that you see throughout the story, for possible use in your home game. But anyway, check it out. I hope you enjoy it. We're real proud of it. Stream of Many Eyes starts tomorrow. Ashley and me are going to be playing on a game tomorrow night for Force Grey and then a bunch of us are going to be there on Sunday throughout the day doing various games. You can check out dnd.wizards.com/SoME for all the information for this weekend. If you can't be there in person, they are streaming it so at least you can check it all out there. It's going to be a lot of fun. Cool reveals, and crazy stuff.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: So crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's so crazy. Talks Machina is every Tuesday evening at 7:00pm Pacific where our fantastic, recently-escaped-from-the-Far-Realm Brian W. Foster will be hosting. This is discussed next week on the things that happened in this week's episode you're about to see. So check it out. It should be fun. I will be at A-Kon, June 8th to the 10th. So in a couple weeks, I'll be out there at Dallas/Fort Worth for panels, signings and going to talk and hang out with people as much as I can. So if you're in that area, come say hello! I believe--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I've got one thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, what you got? What you got, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh well, I was just perusing our store recently because sometimes I do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Full of good stuff!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is full of good stuff, but something I noticed that we haven't announced is that the rings that we had forever ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The d20 ring?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The d20 spinner rings? Those things are in the store right now. I don't know if we found a stockpile of them that we had missed, but there are some in the store right now. Just so you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where the 20 is the CR logo, too?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do like the idea that we have mystery caches of old items showing up. It's a perpetual surprise! You'll never know what you'll see!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And new items. New items on sale right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's so pretty!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at this. Also, hi, Dread Singles, feel better! Look at that! Look at it on paper! Look at the color! We can hold it and taste it and smell it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Olivia Samson, our fantastic Critter artist, did such a great job on this series. If you haven't had a chance to look at her work, please do. She's amazing. And on that note, let us all jump in to tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (drum beat) [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He would totally do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hmm, that's a 6th-level spell. Anyway, welcome back. To catch up on what previously occurred. The Mighty Nein had decided to leave Zadash in the wake of the now declared war between the Dwendalian Empire and the Xhorhasian hordes to the east. You decided to side with The Gentleman, a purveyor of various darker and underhanded deeds throughout this side of the Empire who offered you two possible contracted options. You chose both and proceeded onto your first leg of this journey to the northeast to the Labenda Swamp and to the city of Berleben where you were tasked to discover what had happened to a safe house of which various smuggled goods would be stored and then transported through, that had gone dark for a number of weeks. You packed up, made your way in that direction, traversed through the outskirts of the swamp, managed to save a tiny bird friend from being consumed by a few large crocodiles and scoured the swamp city of Berleben in search of some means of information to find the individual that The Gentleman says would be able to help you in this journey, Febron. Febron was found, drunk and disorderly, in the Keystone Pub.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so sexy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lightless, as there are no windows and you just eventually come to on what you assume is an evening's full rest. You all independently come to shake your heads and get yourselves prepared for what the next day's journey arises, you gather your things and you glare at the rather awkward Febron across the way, who, as you wake up, is just sitting there watching you sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Ew.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're so creepy. I'm going to pull the bed out from the door. Are you ready to get up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I mean, I'm ready to do whatever you want. Lead the way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Great. (retches) Okay. Open the door, we'll head upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys begin to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We wake up all cuddled in a pile in our room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Just floofy with Kiri in between.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chirping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little cuddle pile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "It's sharp!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't sleep with the daggers, Kiri. You want to remove them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chirping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should have taught her that last night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's pretty-- I'm glad we're alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all begin to gather and make your way up the ladder, through the hatch in the floor of the Keystone Pub, which is not bustling by any means. There are maybe three patrons in the process of having their morning ale. You glance over the side and you can see Dent Bonswallow who's in the process of cleaning off a number of the glasses from the night before. He looks over in your direction and goes, "Oh, right. Bright morning to you all. Rise up! Would you like breakfast of some kind, hey?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a lot of fucking energy this early in the morning. God. (clears throat)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like so much of whatever you have, please, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Coming right up! Go an find a place to sit, be with you in about an hour."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: An hour?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I've got to make your food!" (grumbling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have to go and kill it first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's counting. "About an hour."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh. That's a long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. What are we going to do until then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like an Easy-Bake Oven.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, should we explore the street that we're on? I mean, we've got a long wait time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we see if the-- oh, no. The horses were taken.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They took the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the stables.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's all situated there. There is, in the far corner of the chamber, the back wall opposite to the right of where the stage is being constructed-- though right now, it looks like there's no current construction going on at the moment-- a hooded figure is slowly walking towards the table where you guys are deciding or not whether to sit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We run for it and we get the table first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You manage to sit on one of the small benches on the side. Scrapes the ground as you push into the side and the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my staff and I lay it long ways over the entire bench on the other side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The old movie theater grab?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cloaked figure stops and takes in this physical display, and then continues to approach.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin walks to the edge of the table and shows his butthole by lifting his tail up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're always so mean to the guests!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark Hulmes, long-time friend, dungeon master of High Rollers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just can't believe he got here.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You tried.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first thing you see: the individuals you have been waiting throughout the evening to show up begin to step through, groggily complain about the space and then claim a table as you begin to approach, which you are greeted with stares and a cat butthole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This table is taken by The Mighty Nein, but if you need anything, there's other tables.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh yeah. Hi, actually, I kind of-- You see this feminine-looking figure. Long black hair that covers almost the entire side of her left face, wearing a hood up, dark green cloak, black and green clothes, you can occasionally see green ribbons in her long hair. She is like: I'm really sorry to bother you guys, just-- I couldn't help but overhear some conversation you had last-- I'm sorry to be really forward. Are you heading into the swamp today?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You were listening in to our conversations?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Not on purpose. I'm really desperate to find a way into the swamp and you were talking really loudly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like your ribbons.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Thank you. Oh my-- you're blue! And she (gasps) And she looks up at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No. I mean, you're so cute! And looks around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you don't mind us asking, why are you heading into the swamp yourself?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh. Well, it's kind of a long story just--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well we have an hour.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It's also a bit of, well, I mean. You guys haven't been hired by any creepy people in dragon masks, have you? You don't know anyone like that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, not for several years for a different reason.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely a long time since I've dealt with anyone in a dragon mask.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've never seen anyone in a dragon mask before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've been hired by creepy people, but not by-- Oh, so I'm wearing a mask, but that is a different kind of mask. It's not a dragon mask.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same kind of creepy, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And this is a bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chirping)

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: A bird.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Like, it walks around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "A bird."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She. She walks around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "She walks around."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Repeats stuff, yeah.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's kind of the best.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: She's adorable! Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Cali) "Hello?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's doing you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whistles)

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: (stuttering) Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Edubation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pulls a dagger out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Probably not so much like that.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Wow. I've never seen a bird like that before that can talk. Is that your daughter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Yep. Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, he's my dad.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I can tell by the ears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the green.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: There's somewhere, like a smuggler's holdout or like a storehouse, I think maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm. Weird. That's crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a weird thing to put in the middle of a swamp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, well, anyway. What it is that you need with that, though?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Well, somebody was transporting an item I'm looking for and I think it's there and I need to get it before some other people get it. But I'm not stealing it. Well, I kind of am stealing it, but I'm taking it back for a good reason.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the people in the dragon masks that want it?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, it is. You look trustworthy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you getting paid for this item retrieval?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No. It's more of a personal thing. I want to make sure it doesn't get into the wrong hands.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it your underwear?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. What's the item? I mean. I'm sure my father would want to know what's the item.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Your underwear?"

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I think it's part of a ritual and I need to get it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a bowl or a bowl?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I've never seen a bowl like that. You couldn't get a lot of soup in a bowl like that big. I mean a big bowl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a soup bowl, then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What have you been doing after school? Honey?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: After-school activities.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It's really nice to see, to be honest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very open, yeah. We're like best friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I tell him everything.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's good. You need to have that trust between family.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to have a big bowl.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So you're searching for a bowl.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah. That's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And used in rituals?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I think so, yes. I need to make sure it doesn't fall into the wrong hands, that's all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Our business might be headed out that way a little later today. Does she have any weapons on her that are visible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not me!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're not Grog anymore, it's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. That's okay. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Glancing about--

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: There's no obvious weapons that you can see on her, but she has this long green cloak that's really covering her left side and you would probably see that there's black scales all over her left side and she's deliberately holding her arm completely hidden. Her arm's invisible underneath the cloak.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, I'm wondering if she seems straightforward. Is the nervousness an act?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to playing with Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Insight check. Insight check!

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I know. I've seen this show.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Seems to be on the level.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is not a good answer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. She seems nervous.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could go either way on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, based on what you're asking. As far as the features, if I recall, they're was it half-elven?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah. The human half looks half-elven, ever so slightly elven features. Slightly pointed ear, but the left side covered.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A dangerous bowl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A soup bowl used in rituals.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't want to get it in the wrong hands because--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of people in dragon masks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think they're sending people to get it there before you?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I love your jewelry by the way. It's really nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I've picked everything out myself. This is all put together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (tinkling)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, why do these people want the bowl that you're talking about?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: They're-- Do any of them have holy symbols or religious symbols anywhere on their person?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm literally covered in them.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Of who?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody. Literally, the coat is made up of seven different options.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody who is legal within the Empire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. But there's also-- yeah.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Is the Platinum Dragon one of those?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I'm wearing a Platinum Dragon necklace.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Okay. She notices the Platinum Dragon. Are you a worshipper of the Platinum Dragon by any chance?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Okay, yeah. Well, if you're traveling with somebody who's a worshipper of the Platinum Dragon, I guess I can trust you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good for us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's incredibly trustworthy and he worships like crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what everybody says.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, by the gods, that's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Remind me to show you my tapestries.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that code for something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it's literally my tapestries.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just don't touch them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because he's had them wrapped around his weenie.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Like. Oh my good-- uh, well, um.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's high on sugar. Don't listen to her. Anyway.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah. Have you ever heard of the Scaled Tyrant?

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Well, it's probably a good thing. They're not a very nice goddess and the worshippers of her are after this bowl and I need to stop them getting it. They're not good people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you have a reason to believe that they are expeditiously heading towards this bowl as well?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: They bought it and I think they're after it now, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a very tactless question, but you are talking about the Scaled Tyrant and you also are sporting some scales. Is that a coincidence or are they related?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'm sorry, a lot of people get really nervous when they see them. I'm not diseased or cursed or anything just-- yeah, I've--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're pretty cool.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: She brushes the hair to her side and she adjusts the cloak and you can see the whole left side is black dragon scales and her hand is a draconic claw.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: A black dragon tail sweeps out from under the cloak. I'm like a tenth dragon and some people get freaked out by that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're sure you're just a tenth?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, I think so. All I know is that a great ancestor of mine was a black dragon and I've inherited some of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a full dragon?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I've been told.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think it's pretty sexy to be honest." You see Febron there, is this creepier old man, balding, little liver spotted, missing most of his teeth, one eye wandering a bit.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Is he with you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he's going to take us where we need to go.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, so--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's work for hire.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Okay. All right. I'm just going to stand next to Caleb, away from this guy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've had shorter conversations with family members. What's your name?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, sorry. I'm Calianna, you can call me Cali.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kelly?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Cali.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cali. Calianna, that's cool.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Hi! Nice to meet you all. What are your names?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Nott) "Welcome to the Mighty Nein!" The little bird creature begins to chirp in your direction.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's a really long name.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's Kiri.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, Kiri. Hello Kiri. I am Cali.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Cali) "Hello Kiri. I'm Cali."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No you're Kiri.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Cali) "You're Kiri."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No, I'm Cali.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chirping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only 56 more minutes until breakfast is ready!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the sake of expediency, you share what information you choose to in that space of time, but food does come to you piecemeal as your fine Dent Bonswallow friend decides to deliver it plate by plate as it arrives. It's passable, most of it's a little overcooked breakfast meats, bit of rubbery egg and that's about it. A good swamp breakfast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They need more sugar here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Listen, we are kind of heading in that direction.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I won't be a burden or anything, but if you don't mind me coming, I could use the help. The swamp, I've tried to go out in it by myself, and there's something out there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gators. Giant ones.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: But there's also something else. I haven't quite seen it yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling) You hear this deep, horrible growling sound that echoes around you.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's it, I heard that noise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see Kiri's feathers fluffing up as she does it. (growling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you do that again, Kiri?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we ever heard this sound before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the sound of the crocodiles from the battle before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin travels over to Kiri and starts going (purring) as he nestles against Kiri.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kiri starts fluffing and loosely purring back.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Is that cat with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The cat is with me.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, cats don't like me. They tend to really freak out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I understand that completely. You and I, we're going to be real close, I can feel.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I think they can smell the dragon blood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, they can tell.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Are you a dragon as well?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. I'm allergic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take a step and a half away from Cali.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cali, did you hear any howling in the swamp, because we heard there were howling monsters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing that was howling-esque, necessarily, but you didn't travel too far into the swamp.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No, I didn't really go that far deep in, with the gators and some shadows moving around. I know a little magic, but I've never fought before, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've never fought?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No, I had a bit of a reclused upbringing. I learned magic, I know a few spells, and I learned how to control it a bit. Draconic blood gives me some magic, but I've never been in a real fight before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb can teach you all about magic, he knows all the spells and he's very wise.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Although I don't think we're going to have time for that. If you're going to join us, you're going to have to work for your food, you understand?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I do!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My name's Fjord, by the way.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Nice to meet you Fjord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Beau?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bren.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Bren?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jester Fancypants.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's a brilliant name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Molly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yasha.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I haven't spoken to you. You're very big.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, that's just me.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I like your black and white hair, that's cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're very excitable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "This is Kiri."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Cali.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So can you shoot out fire out your nose, and all that?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Well, kind of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just the one, one nostril?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I could try, yeah. It's mainly if I breathe, it's more acid. But I can control some fire as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have one little wing back there, too?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: No wings, just the tail and the claw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That would have been cool, though.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: The claw's kind of sharp, I learned to fight with it a little bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I see it?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, I'm just-- Is there anybody else around in the tavern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's at this point, two other patrons, but they're not really paying attention.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'll put my back to them, and then I'll move up to Yasha. She takes her cloak off and brings out this scaled--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Jesus Christ! That's your arm?"

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Is that the--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's Febron.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't get me wrong, I still think it's pretty foxy."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's somehow even creepier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what, I appreciate that you're so accepting of everything, Febron.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It is quite nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Been around as long as I have, you live a life of beggars can't be choosers."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And right back in the pit. Anyway.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: But yeah, I'm happy to help, and work, and do what you need me to do. I just really need to get this item. I need to make sure it--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you happen to bring any coin with you?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It's got a little bit of magic, but it's just that-- you can see on her human arm, it's a silver bracelet with a charm token hanging off it with a green emerald.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love trinkets.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It's an arcane focus, I'm told, but it has a little magic to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinkets are pretty great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They are. They always have been.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We normally have a no stranger policy, but we'll keep a close eye on you. If you get up to any tricksy business--

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I promise, no tricksy business from me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hear you talking still. Yeah, Yasha and Molly, they'll remove your head for you. You understand?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very gently and politely, but yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I would probably fashion a cool cover for my arm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm not going to do it, I'm just saying it's really cool. Full transparency.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'll be good. I promise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're not responsible for any injury or death that you may sustain while traveling with us. Even if it is from a member of The Mighty Nein.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we have her sign something? I mean, should we have a release form?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll write up a release form really fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Illustrated?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Illustrate all the things that could happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will illustrate being burned by fire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Castration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pulled apart by gators. Probably something creepy and howling eating you as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is probably stating the obvious, but if you have not picked up on it yourself, we are kind of a pack of assholes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use the colored ink from my mom to make it really gory.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You're not trying to burn me. You're not threatening to kill me because I'm cursed. Yeah, you all seem lovely, really. You're much better than most people I have to deal with, to be honest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here you go. You can sign this.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, we have a deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good, you're in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Welcome to The Mighty Nein!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Jester) "Welcome to The Mighty Nein!"

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: This bird is adorable!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit there's not-- no, we're not ironic any more!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we'll see how we are at the end of the day. Bet that'll fix itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we are. Because when we write the name down, it's actually the Zemnian word for no. So even if there's nine people, then--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're overthinking it Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a double entendre.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lots of pocket bacon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We ordered coffee? We're still waiting on coffee? Is there going to be a desert? Was there a desert menu? Can I get a container? Eggs never keep, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather your things, finish off the remainder of your lackluster breakfast. At this point now, the morning air is chilled, though there is still humidity that permeates the swamp vicinity. You hear the bugs beginning to grow louder with the distant cicada/cricket sounds in the distance echoing through the swamp. There is a low fog that is fairly prominent this early in the morning. You can see about 15 or 20 feet beyond the barrier of the outer swamp before the moisture begins to pick up. You see just the shaded trunks of trees beyond that for another 60 or so feet before it becomes completely obscured by fog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, it's creepy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it always do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This time of year it does. It's just getting close to winter."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have basically zero visibility?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not zero visibility. You have traveling about 30 feet of general visibility, and then it begins to get a little bit beyond that. At this point Febron chimes in. "Don't worry, it burns off "a bit as the day goes on."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Febron, any suggestions whether to move through the muck fine land or through the trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, we're going to go through all of it, really, but we're going to head for the "outside of the Ounterloch."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The where?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Ounterloch."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ounterloch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Under the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're heading towards the lake. We're going to try and make our way around the outskirts of "it, but we're going to have to coast through the swamp to get there. That way we're not trudging "through the main central area too much."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we taking the cart? Or just going on foot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh I wouldn't recommend taking that with us, no."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll leave it, it'll be fine, daughter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, Papa. May I have my allowance now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. You've been naughty. No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott-y.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: He's a very stern dad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He is, but fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are plotting a means out there, Kiri has the dagger out and is practicing little swings excitedly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Kill all of it. Kill the fog, Kiri.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then she goes charging towards the fog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And gets eaten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aww. Damn it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's The Mist.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester's regret.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have to live with this for the rest of my life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kiri has run past the barrier of The Puddles on the north side of the city and is now swinging wildly into the fog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit! Kiri, come back, Kiri.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) Kiri come back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Runs back, feet leaving a trail behind as she's stepping through two to three inches of swamp water across this district. (chirping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have to be careful. There's lots of creatures around that could hurt you, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's lots of creatures around that could hurt you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You always want to stick together. You never want to split the party.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, stay close. Stay close to us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gets right behind Yasha and sticks right to her back with the dagger out on the opposite side going--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should really give her like a sheath or something to put that knife away, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you tell kids to run with scissors, she'll be fine. Can we check to make sure nobody's following us as we're heading out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus four, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing around the city, not a lot of folks are moving. It seems like the nature of the swamp town is a little bit of a slower pace of living by the nature of the location. The few folks that are wandering around the streets are slowly getting to their daily chores and business. No one seems to be particularly interested. A few folks look over because you are a gathered motley crew on the edge of town, but there's no one who seems to be very focused in what's going on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're the best-looking people in this town, and that's saying something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This group is very inclined-- we're very skilled in arcane things. What is your specialty?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, well. You know how some people learn magic from books and some people get magic from gods and stuff, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gods and stuff, ja, okay.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: My magic comes from just me? The draconic blood, I'm told, has magical essences to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. Cool. What can you do with it?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Well, I don't know if I should-- It's a lot of fire and acid, mainly. That seems to be related to the type of dragon I'm from.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, effective.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I can conjure fire. I can make a lot of fire. Varying of degrees of fire, really, and acid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have maybe one B-side besides the fire?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Besides fire and acid, a little bit of poi-- I can drain life force and invigorate myself a little bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Say "fire" one more time.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fire. Fire. Fire. Fire." (chirping)

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Caleb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wrapped around his weenie."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good pull!

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You have magic with that? Is that like an implement or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Deep pull already! That was like 40 minutes ago!

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You said that crows are really smart, so I'm guessing she knows-- what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's so much quicksand in this swamp. I'm feeling trapped. I feel like we have a little bit of overlap, you know. I'm able to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has lots of fire.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Really? You don't have any dragon blood in you, do you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, that's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN, SAM
lines.text: Nine dragons.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You meant the Zemnian "nein." Not the number.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Step off, Tiamat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well done. That's a good joke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So we good to go? Ready to move? The longer we take the more risk we run of getting there "about nighttime, and I would feel a bit nervous about that to be honest."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No please, lead on. We're quite anxious to get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, so, who's leading?"

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm pointing the direction, no, but I'm not standing at the front.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For 100 gold, I think you will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "100 gold, I'm pointing the direction, but look at me, I'm not going to defend you well."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, but we'll be right behind you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, but if I die first, you're going to be lost in this swamp!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's only got one eye, he can't possibly see what's going on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fine, I'll take the lead, who wants to join me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll join you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you both, don't fight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you want to like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's fine, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, I'm trying to wingman you here right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take the back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll also go in the back.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, I can shoot things at range or close up if need be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If need be, but you know. Wait for the need to be.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, where are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to use my ring of water walking, and I'm going to be the same level as Beau except 30 feet to the right. Just as a flanking--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to carry Kiri on my shoulders.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kiri on your shoulders?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so that she doesn't have to walk through the muck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's Kiri. She's up there with the two feathered arms flopped over and (chirping) looking around.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Holding onto your head like a kid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just feathers in your face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like where we are positioned, what do you think?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'll go wherever you need me to. Mr. Fjord said that I'm to do whatever so I'll go wherever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How does she know there's a J in your name really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I honestly don't have an answer for that.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I was pretty sure you said "Fjord," but okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all pretty sure about that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said it right, it's "Ford."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Thanks, "Mr. Ford."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's "Mee-ster Ford."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: "Mee-ster Ford." All right, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (like Cali) "Mee-ster Ford."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Jesus, Kiri. All right, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point Febron's like, "All right so looking out this direction, this time of day-- "that way! Lead on, big boy."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. You're actually going to be scouting, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin to step past the outskirts of The Puddles, your feet begin to sink thicker and thicker into the swamp floor as you further and further step away from this little bastion of civilization. With each progressive footstep you can see the waves ripple past and then hit patches of thick elevated vegetation that's growing and rotting in small clusters simultaneously. The tree trunks that are faded shadows begin to come into view and you begin to see these twisted, gnarled trees covered in vines that dangle down from these high boughs that barely cluster out sections of sunlight, and you pass out underneath those areas where bits of cloud begin to break through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was a joke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, gotcha

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said, "Hi, Beaus."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, boughs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. But I said "Hi, Beaus."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three out of five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's fine. In pushing this forward and guiding the path, I'm going to have Febron and whoever is keeping watch on the exterior to both make survival checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean on the exterior?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm keeping watch on the right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm keeping watch up front.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm looking on the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The gators come from the left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Well this isn't a perception check, this is to make their way through the swamp to keep track of what's ahead, so I'm having Febron and one of you take point on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What kind of a check is this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Survival.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a survival check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Oh, I thought it was actually higher when I first looked at it. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, you both rolled pretty high. Over the next two hours or so, you guys manage to keep for the most part above any of the deeper recesses of marsh water. Leaping from cluster of tree base and sections of ground that are mostly above the water line, it manages to go through without much of an issue. The fog does slowly begin to burn off as the hours progress, but it's still present. You gather probably about the time you arrived at the end of day yesterday to the exterior of the Labenda Swamp, there was just a faint bit of fog at the ground. It will be a number of hours before you even reach that point, but it is progressing towards a more visible space. These two hours you guys continue forward, being mindful and watching around. Those who are keeping watch, I need both of you to make perception checks or one of you make it with advantage, your choice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's me and who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoever else is keeping a watch. You want to make it, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to make it with advantage or separate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nah. One.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not great for me either. Six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez Louise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Clear on the right!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Clear on the front!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, front--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Clear on the left? Man, which way am I looking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's really reassuring when there's a question mark on the end of your statement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is generally how it goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Febron at this point's still looking. He says, "Wait, hold on a second." He starts doing a little circle in the area, checking out some of the recent trees, looking at the sun in the sky and he's like, "Yeah. I feel like we're going the right way."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, just to be clear: Your job-- your only job was to walk to a building and back for god knows how many years and you think we're going the right way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, we don't usually leave this early in the morning."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you still drunk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (noncommittal grunt)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you need to be drunk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: LIAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not a problem. Bren, would you help our friend out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Yes, it's me, Bren. Yeah, I'll be right over.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: She's oblivious, completely lost. She's looking around like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Febron, do you have any cups? I don't want you to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pulls out a half-filled wineskin, opens it up, pours the water out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have some booze. I'll fill it to the brim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks curiously at the flask and the amount of liquid you poured in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cheers indeed. Tiny girl." He watches as you drink the alcohol and is confused. Gets a closer look at you at this point and he goes--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now is not the time to start making judgments, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does that clear your memory?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye. It's this way." Make another survival check.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Mr. Fjord, you're very liberal with your parenting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Sunny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's just milk.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh. That makes sense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, that's really frustrating. Seven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you both roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it was Febron and Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven. Not good. I keep getting so close.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we not get advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be fine."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Sounds great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Fjord, as you are stepping near the front you come around the corner and without notice there's this strange sound. This (airy puff) and there's a cloud of pollen-like spores in the air right where you are. I need you to make a wisdom saving throw, please.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's very wise, he'll be fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh jeez.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's always a good sign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pull back, coughing a bit, and your head goes dazed for a moment, but you manage to shrug it off. You guys look ahead and beyond the area where Fjord was pushing, around one of the trees you can see this large, 30-foot wide cloud of yellowish pollen that went (airy puff) and slowly settles into the swamp area.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Blimey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we see a source where it came from? A plant or a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a whole mess of twisted vines and plant matter in the center of the space. Where it seemed to emit from, the center, though, you do see one large fern-type plant that's left open and three or four large leaves that are spread outward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that doesn't look very hospitable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Febron.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should avoid those, huh?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Is this a thing that happens, I'm assuming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't actually seen this close to one of them. I usually avoid them. So let's avoid it, eh?"

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Hello, Mr. Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I don't know if this is-- do you want me to burn it all away?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cali, that is a very good idea.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Like that area, right? Is that where it came from?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, hoping the pollen's not flammable, but sure try it.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Is it flammable, Mr. Creepy Pervert?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "First off, I resent that."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the "Mr." was pretty respectable, all things considered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take that. I mean, I figure it's probably in the way, burn it if you can. I don't "trust it."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: How wide radius is this area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This vicinity is about 30 feet around this particular plant in the center that's lying open, face to the sky.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: 20-foot radius would--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would encompass the plant, definitely.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Fireball. The dragon claw comes out, and this green flame magic coalesces. She flicks out this green orb that fires down, and when it hits it detonates.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It emits this large blast of orangish-red fire that burns in the area. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Can I have a d6 from somebody? I need six more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's three.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Feel free to dive through the bag for anything you need.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dang it, I'm trying to get to my bag to help you, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's filled with a baby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Baby's in the way. Get used to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't bend. Whoa.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'm taking that, it's a six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a high roller.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That's very good. That's going to be 28 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant three, four part maw closes in the space with these plant-like teeth. It's still there, writhing in pain from the explosion. It laxes open a bit and begins to shift in your direction. It looks hurt, but still alive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It moves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sacred Flame.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fire Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Fire Bolt, Sacred Flame, that's cocked. That's a 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dex save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, yeah, so no Sacred Flame but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17 for Fire Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 hits, roll damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. That is not that much, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a dex check, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Or no-- yeah. For Sacred Flame, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 12.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of damage. As you slam it with the Fire Bolt, it (shrieks) and keeps moving forward, but it's hurt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Toll the Dead!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rolled another 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you give me six second increments, I'm just going to go (releasing spells).

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: When it's within 60 feet, I can Acid Splash it as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for fun, (Infernal) stay down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some days you can't get rid of a bomb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll give it a whirl. I'll reach up near my eye, and you see this little arc of energy pop out from my eye towards my hand. I'll throw it forward and cast Witch Bolt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Witch Bolt.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which bolt do you cast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all preparing your various cantrips and spells against it. It begins lurching forward. You can see the charred edges of this large vegetable plant. Then Fjord steps forward sending this arc of darker, gray-green energy that strikes into it. Roll damage-- roll to hit first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, thank you, yeah. Ten plus six, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, great. This is overkill, it's 3d12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's nine--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good rolls!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 27 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it strikes this large, trap-like plant, it hits the center of it. It bubbles up for a second, the green and red matter of the interior swells and then pops. Like a horrible flesh-filled water balloon spatters across various areas. You guys have to take a step back and it glides against your knees and thighs a bit.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Can I use Shape Water to keep it out of my way? My cantrip just (disgusted groan).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just manages to avoid you. But it lies now, decimated and sinking slowly into the swamp water.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, sorry. I thought I'd kill it the first time. I'm sorry you had to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it was a really encouraging display. I was not expecting it to be so durable.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Yeah, me neither. I thought it was just a plant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should really avoid those in the future, huh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well that's one in an entire swamp of vegetation. So we should be good now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's it going over there, guys?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything on the right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, all clear!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anything on the left?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm asking for anything on the left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there somebody on the left?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not anymore with these rolls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who else wants to make a perception check?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I roll obnoxiously bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo-hoo, 13!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a very faint hiss through the distant branches of the trees, singing in unison, as bits of leaves and vines clatter against themselves from the shift. But you manage to catch a sound upon the wind that is unfamiliar to the rest of the natural breeze. It's like a chime. Like a wooden chime (dull thunks).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) I hear something.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: (whispering) What do you hear?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hear a chime.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (gong)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, like little wind chimes. Like we had at home.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Oh, that sounds nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: It can't be anything bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We used to hang them in our balconies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can listen up and can hear it for a moment too as the breeze blows through a second time. Kiri makes the same sound (dull thunks).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It sounded like that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah. The little bamboo ones. Those are great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like it's a little bit northward of where you're headed. A little north--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Febron, is that where the thing is, that we're going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, it could be."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: North is that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We could avoid it, though."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so it's not the safe house, it's another building, for sure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know what the hell that is. I haven't heard that out here before."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should find out what it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I actually tend to agree. I don't want to leave things undiscovered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you sure about that?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did we pay you for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm helping you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's questionable. It's honestly debatable.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: He seems to be doing his best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Don't thank me, you're weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin. I'm going to sit on a relatively dry spot if I can find one. I'm going to go blind and deaf and send Frumpkin in the direction, with Jester's help, towards the sound that she heard.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I make it drier for Caleb, using Shape Water, dry out some of the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. You cause some of the swamp mass to pull back a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Surf pro.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin takes a little bit, because this terrain is not very conducive to prowling cats of Frumpkin's size. But Frumpkin heads on for a bit, coming across the source of this sound. You see about 100 or so feet ahead in the direction where you heard the sound, hanging from one of the branches, there is indeed a cluster of carved chimes that are dangling from a piece of twine there. They're banging into each other every now and then when the breeze slowly comes through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just in a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On a branch, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's creepy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will give the group a basic narration as I see these things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can give a perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My basic perception check is not too bad. It is a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. From Frumpkin's view underneath, you can get a close look at it, and the material of the chimes isn't wood. It appears to be yellowed, old, dried, hollowed bone. The twine itself is not twine. It appears to have been tanned or dried sinew.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (disgusted) Oh, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What was that word?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sinew.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Super inviting. Just all the tendons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our wind chimes were made of wood.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much of it are Frumpkin and I looking at? It's one little ditty or are we talking True Detective here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently it's just the one chime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does Frumpkin see anything around, like any living things?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't hear shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: True.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this sound like some sort of ward against the undead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't catch your mind as anything that is a defensive mechanism to undead that you would recognize.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's hanging from a tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, about seven feet above Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to send Frumpkin up the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to send Frumpkin toward the branch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin manages to climb the tree using the outside of the somewhat twisted bark, getting to the top. From that viewing point, as Frumpkin gets out there you can-- (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to hold my hand? I try to hold Caleb's hand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cat growling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's clammy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see from the top of the branch, beyond the edge of the fog, there looks to be a thick tree that has broken and fallen over about ten feet from the base. The heavy roots rise up into this trunk that still stands about nine or ten feet from the base of the swamp floor. It appears like there is a hollow carved into it, circular, and a curtain that is currently pressed, bolted, or nailed into it that is partially blocking an opening into the tree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like sealed or nailed in so it's hanging down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hanging down and every now and then a faint breeze comes through and you see it shift ever so slightly. But it's a heavy material.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, what I would like to attempt to do is send Frumpkin up to and stick his head inside, and as soon as I get a little peeky-poo, snap my fingers and bamf him out into the Fey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As Frumpkin-- make a stealth check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on Frumpy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lumpy Frumpy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A big 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Good to know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is better than 12.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A baker's dozen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remember when I used to get a 45.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin stalks up through, avoiding the sleight depressed elements of the floor that fill with the thicker bog water. Coming upon the outskirts you can see the curtain that hangs is not cloth. It appears to be a scaled leather-like material. Actually pretty similar to what you had carved from the crocodile the day before. But long weathered and it's dry towards the top, but the base of it seems to have been progressively moistened by the swamp around it. As such, it's slightly decomposing, and it has a bit of moss and algae that's grown on it, giving it a lighter green at the tip. Looking inside, there is a layer of bones that are all broken, and chipped to the point where it's given a textured base to the floor. From this view, you're not able to make out what the bone source is or what they're from. But there is a gentle layer of bones of varying degrees of age to them. Within there you also see-- there is natural rot on the inside of this trunk, that's let it easily be carved away. There appears to be a matted pile of something in the corner. Other than that, in the brief instant that Frumpkin's paying attention, it appears to be empty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That pile was definitely something sleeping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin returns to his realm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, like I was saying to you, there is a tree out there and there is something sleeping in it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you hear anything, snoring?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but there are a lot of bones there. They looked like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of bones?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They are not chicken bones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like gator bones, maybe though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, they were probably smaller than that, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You literally got in quickly and went (poof).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, bones aren't normally a very good sign.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: That doesn't seem very good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There was something in the corner. Something that was not bones, but it wasn't moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet it was a friendly person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It definitely wasn't the thing we're looking for.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't happen to see a bowl, did you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did not see a bowl. I made a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the brief instant you looked in there, you got a few details in the interior before pulling way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, not bowls, just bones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll tell you what, let's go to the safe house and then we'll come back if we are not completely almost dead, and see what we see there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Save it for a rainy day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very wise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Especially if there is no bowl in the safe house. Then we know some other place to look for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one's a gimme, a bonus, only if we feel up to it.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You're all so brave.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think we'll be able to find our way back here? Should we mark a tree or something like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's mark a tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cause Fabron doesn't seem to know which way his ass is, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not true at all."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which way's your ass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's right here."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: North is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's that way."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: North is-- no it is that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what I said."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're pointing over there, I'm pointing over here. North is that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pull out my sword, and I'm going to carve into the side of the tree a big sign that says "Here Lies Salty Pete" with an arrow down, straight below.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Who's Salty Pete?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, but it sounds like something awful happened to him, doesn't it?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Aw, that's really sad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have a way of magically marking this as well so we can have a bit of a compass?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A compass?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah like a point-- can you do a thing where you can put a pin in this tree?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Can you do that, Mr. Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, a couple things, one, this is a compass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's true! Never mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we'll find our way back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not an issue. But if you want to know if something's happening here with Salty Pete, we can also do that if you give me ten minutes. But it doesn't seem like that's what you're--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that's not fair. As long as we can make our way back here again one way or the other, and I suppose that's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do not know where the safe house is, but anywhere we have been we can get to again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Let's go to the safe house then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue moving on?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lead on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Febron goes, "All right. That way," and he points in the direction and ushers you forward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You did a good job the first time, let's take it up again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What pace are you moving at? Normal pace, slow pace, fast pace?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We always move at a medium pace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, medium pace it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could cast Pass Without a Trace on anyone within 30 feet of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could. You have to move at a slow pace to move stealthily, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think our speed is halved in the conditions, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most of it, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so it would be super slow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doing the slo-mo game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, maybe not then. Maybe when we go back to the creepy tree, we can do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue on, Febron and-- Beau, are you the other one with Febron doing the survival checks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make one more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. Natural 20! Gil!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're getting very close to getting out of this fucking swamp and getting next to the Ounterloch "that'll lead us there. No issue, no more of this." Right as he's saying that, you watch him about to step into another one of those open plants that begins to quake, and you watch as it's about to release this burst of pollen, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go: Oh, you're about to-- watch it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes (puffing).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice, he's dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "What? (coughing)" and starts walking straight towards it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I grab him. Can I reach out and grab him? Trying to cover my mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check for you to try and grapple him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Either that or we lose our shithole guide.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which is really not losing much at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. Okay, we lose our 100 gold investment. Athletics, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Acrobatics. Sorry, athletics for you to grapple him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Ooh! Nope, it's worse than I thought. It's real bad. It's an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You reach and grab him, but he shrugs off your arm and starts walking.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: As he's about to step, can I cast Levitate on him and lift him up into the air? He doesn't step on it, with the claw, the green magic comes out and (whoosh) up into the air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He continues to walk towards it, and then glides up in the air and is floating. He's reaching towards it, and the plant (slurping) and is trying to reach for him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my staff and bat him away like a helium balloon. Just start batting him back over away from it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's now floating and slowly rotating in the air, like (grunting).

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'll be raising him up and down, shaking him in the air, like, "Come on, shake out of it, come on!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we try to outmaneuver this one now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I think we've already had our fun with the one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I open my journal and start drawing him as a balloon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold on. We're not done.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, there's a lot happening over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you the better part of a minute to finally shake him out of it, before he goes, "Oh, "is it-- what? Shit! (yelling) Shit, what's going on?!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shushing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The plant's still below him, going like (slurping).

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Ms. Beau, could you nudge him off to the side? I'm getting tired of this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You poke him and he begins to glide over--

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Then I'll lower him down--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The plant is now turning towards him, slowly shifting in his direction, and he's like "Backing "away, there's a fucking--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I now grab him by the collar and try and drag him away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you move around the side and you pull him away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys begin to pick up your pace. This plant is not very fast-moving, and you, even moving at your slower pace, it can't keep up with you and it eventually gives up and disappears into the fog behind you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The loneliest plant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love that you roll a 20 to see it before him and and went, "Sure."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love it, it's great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Watch your step, man! Ah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Febron. You've been through this swamp once or many times?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a bit late in the game, but are you being completely forthright with us? Is he?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to read.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I make a suggestion, Febron? And I cast Suggestion on Febron.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.
